headline: Loaded Chicken Carbonara
description: This take on a classic Italian pasta dish makes an easy and delicious weeknight dinner.
name: Loaded Chicken Carbonara
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes. Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Drain fat from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons of the bacon drippings.

Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon bacon drippings in the skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken breast halves in the bacon drippings until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer to cutting board and tent with foil. Rest chicken for 5 minutes before slicing; set aside.

Heat remaining tablespoon bacon drippings in skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Cook and stir garlic and ground black pepper in skillet until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour wine into skillet; cook at a simmer until thickened, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Whisk Parmesan cheese and eggs together in a bowl. Slowly stream wine mixture into the Parmesan mixture while whisking continually.

Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Remove 1/2 cup of the water from the pot for later use.

Put the peas in a large colander. Drain the pasta in the colander with the peas. Return drained pasta and peas to the pot. Stir bacon, chicken, and wine mixture into the spaghetti. Thin sauce with reserved pasta water as desired.

review.reviewBody: Nothing better than wife walking in the door from work and saying "whatever it is you are cooking smells delicious." This was my first attempt at a carbonara - amazing! Going to be making this again.
I followed recipe exactly as written and it was awful. Not sure what went wrong but I will not be making this again.
Made it for thr firehouse. They loved it
I liked all the flavors but definately needs more sauce. I also used chicken stock instead of wine. The next day I made a second batch of sauce and added it to the pasta. Much imoroved!
It was excellent! My girlfriend was in love with it! Only change I made was instead of pasta water I used heavy cream it was delicious!
Very easy to make, I would add a bit more garlic next time. I did finish it off with a bit of cream
I chopped up the chicken first. This was really good!
Amazing! Worried it would be too plain so I added sauted onions, chopped broccoli, and roasted red peppers at the end. Only thing I would do different is add more black pepper.
Very tasty....Great recipe! I needed to make a quick dinner and this is quick and delicious! What would we do without chicken?!

I Really enjoyed this recipe. I only tweaked it a little. Am extra egg, less pasta, I forgot the wine(oops), added a Roma tomato and I didnt use chicken. I just poured the egg mixture straight into a pot where everything else was.
DELICIOUS!!
I ate leftovers 2 days in a row for lunch a few days later. added a pinch of milk and reheated slowly .
I Highly recommend this recipe!
My sauce was too thick but I just added some of the spaghetti water and it was fine.
I made this today. Delicious - thanks!

I made this exactly as said except only used 1 chicken breast so I could add shrimp too. I cooked the shrimp with the garlic and pepper. The only thing I would do different next time is less noodles. I feel it took from some of the flavor. Definitely a keeper.

3/27/20 ... Bibi:
"Last night, I made up a dish that DS#1 called, "Almost Carbonara". It had leftover cooked chicken, broth and petite peas from the freezer, white wine from an open bottle and some mushrooms in the fridge, a pound of pasta, an onion, some garlic and Italian seasoning from the pantry, some cooked bacon, and some Italian parsley from a pot on the patio, and some grated Parmesan from a wedge in the fridge. I asked him how it was different from Carbonara, and he said mine was not as creamy. Well, I didn't have any cream, so I thickened the broth with a flour slurry."
Turned out great. My 12 year old son wasn’t to sure about the wine taste.

My wife and I make this quite a bit. As written it’s great. I cook the chicken with Italian seasoning and wrap it in cling wrap to rest then I shred the chicken and use the juices for the sauce. I also use broccoli florets instead of peas.
I made this, or a version of this. I used 3 cups heavy cream, 8 egg yolks for the cream and 1 lb of bacon - it was excellent!
I added a couple of extra eggs and tempered them with the pasta water. It turned out great! Great recipe!!
I added 2 cups fresh spinach after all was combined and served after spinach wilted. Easy recipe and huge hit!
Very good and very easy. I stuck to recipe this time but you could easily play around with it.
It didn't blow my mind, I would give it 3 stars but I'm dumb and put a billion more peas in than it called for so any flavor deficiencies are certainly partially on my account

My husband loved it!
I added frozen peas. Very good, but pasta soaked up all the sauce for leftovers. My husband didn't complain though.
Good, hearty meal!
Delish and easy to make did no changes except cut chicken the cook it and season with garlic onion powder

Turned out great! Even despite the fact that I used the cheap grated (powder-like) Parmesan cheese. I used frozen mixed veggies, instead of just the peas. I didn’t have as much chicken so I should’ve used more veggies, but still delicious. Like other reviewers I cut up the chicken prior to cooking. I want to make again when I have mushrooms on hand.

Follow the instructions from several other reviewers and added 1/2 cup pasta water and 1/2 cup more wine. After we stirred the pan reduction into the egg and Parmesan mixture, we poured it in the pot over the drained pasta and peas and stirred vigorously over the hot but off burner until a creamy sauce was formed. Perfect! No grit or graininess and super creamy. Thumbs up from the whole family!

I liked the recipe, I did change a couple things like the noodles, I used vegetable noodles and I didn’t have peas in hand but had a lot of Brussel sprouts and my husband loved it and my kids liked green spaghetti noodles I made. So win win for us. I added additional water because it was very thick.
What a poor written recipe to result in such a dry sauce. Never again. What a waste of time.
Excellent flavor, but I had to add sauce as it became very dry. I did add mushrooms and used cooked chicken to save time.
Not good instruction. No where near enough sauce for the noodles. End result was bland

This is a keeper for our family! I used a herb rotisserie chicken and pulled it and used chicken broth instead of wine. It's not easy pleasing three teenagers for dinner, but this one did! The rotisserie chicken made it even quicker to make. Will definitely make it again!
This is a great recipe! It’s about the only recipe on this site/app that I don’t feel the need to change.
I thought it was really good.
Delicious! I added extra Parmesan and murikame instead of peas (extra protein) - so good!!

This was so good and relatively easy to make. It was creamy and the flavors were well balanced. I did not add any of the extra pasta water because the sauce was a good consistency. I added mushrooms which I sautéed with the garlic and I cooked the chicken after I cut it up. I added extra bacon which was a big hit. I would definitely recommend this meal, though I would not say itis an easy weeknight meal.
Great recipe!! I added onion and mushrooms to have a few more things on it but other than that I followed the recipe roc a T.

I used chicken broth since I had no wine. Even with the added watch at the end it still was very thick. Would have liked more of a cream flavor, will experiment with seasonings next time too as it was bland to me.
Very easy to make. The family enjoyed it. Just a little bland. I would add some additional spices the next time I make this.
I doubled recipe to make for my daughter also!! Although flavor was good .. I wouldn't double again .. but all in all very good!!
Very bad. I followed to a " "T". It was awful. Tge wine didnt cook out. Way too much noodles. It was down right inedible. Horrible reciepe. I love this site.
Very bad. I followed to a " "T". It was awful. Tge wine didnt cook out. Way too much noodles. It was down right inedible. Horrible reciepe. I love this site.
I added onion and mushrooms. I also used chicken thighs, it's what I had on hand. It was very good.
This is great recipe...very flavorful... but it needs more sauce. I would one and a half times the sauce recipe. Then it would be amazing!
OMG it was so yummy and not only did my Husband love this recipe so did my Co-Workers for lunch the next day. I highly recommend you try this recipe.
Another family hit! So tasty! I'm not a big fan of peas so with 2 cups it was a little much for me, next time I'll just try it with 1. Other then that super tasty and fun to make!

My sauce was too thick and grainy so ended up adding cream and whipping it in the metal bowl over the boiling pasta water which then overflowed all over my stove! Not sure what I did wrong to end up with that result but luckily I was able to save the disaster I had created. The end result was delicious though!

Absolutely delicious! Halved the recipe, but used 2 eggs and upped the wine so it wasn't super thick. During the step while cooking garlic, I added a Roma tomato chopped, small pieces of broccoli, and balsamic vinegar, and omitted the peas altogether. Will DEFINITELY be making this again. Absolutely delicious and can't wait to sop up the juices next time with garlic bread.

Meh...not that impressed. I used roasted chicken meat and tossed it lightly with the bacon grease until it was hot. Used applewood smoked bacon and added mushrooms. Sauce was too thick and very grainy. I would recommend using only 3/4 - 1 cup of parmesan cheese and only 2 eggs. I would also thin it with either some chicken broth or water depending on your tastes.
So good! I need to thin the sauce more next time, but it was delicious!
I swapped out the spaghetti for bow tie pasta and added the step of sautéed mushrooms in the bacon grease.
Yummy! Our kids loved it. Start boiling your water first.
I used up my leftover thanksgiving turkey instead of the chicken. So delicious and great way to enjoy the turkey in a new way!
We loved it! We used penne pasta and took the suggestion of adding mushrooms. We made about 2/3 of the recipe (just 2 of us), and had it for two meals. Definitely will make again, even for company!!

This recipe was delicious. I traveled throughout Italy tasting carbonara and am married to an Italian- so I had high expectations. I did double the sauce because I was serving 6, and I wanted to make sure I had enough sauce to coat the pasta well. I also cut the chicken in smaller pieces and cooked in the pan instead of cooking and cutting later. We left out the peas because we don't care for them, and made sure to add enough salt and pepper. It was delicious! Serve with a side salad to lighten it up and it was awesome!
My Italian husband LOVED this as did my two kiddos. It is very filling and definately not for those counting their calories.
Added a bit more bacon dripping. Gave a bit more flavor.

Only things different I did was cook chicken and bacon together in oven to save time and dirty dishes. I also only used 2 eggs because that was all I had so adjusted Parmesan to only about 1 cup. Great recipe. Will cook again
This was fantastic, and easy to make. I used the chicken broth instead of wine.

Delicious! I used angel hair pasta and sauteed chopped spinach/kale mix with the garlic (instead of the peas). I also used leftover roasted chicken and pre-cooked bacon pieces because that's what I had on hand. Will definitely make this again. Perfect for weeknight dinner!

I loved this recipe because it wasn't high in fat, and so simple and delicious. Of course we add our own flavor touches and mine was fresh basil and pancetta instead of regular bacon. I saved it to my recipe box for future carbonara nights.
This was great, I shredded the chicken and omitted the wine. My family loved it and ate the whole pan.
Added red pepper at the end

This recipe was excellent! I used bacon grease that I had saved from making bacon previously and turkey bacon bits to reduce the calorie count a little. Still, it remained an extremely flavorful one-bowl meal.
Delicious and easy enough for a weeknight dinner.

Pretty good, but I felt it was missing something as the recipe is written. I added mushrooms, as some other reviewers did. It needed more salt and pepper, and I sprinkled Parmesan cheese on top. Still felt like it needed a little something, but wasn't able to quite put my finger on it. Both adults at dinner liked it (including me), but my 9 YO did not. Will definitely make this again, as it was very good, but will experiment a bit with the recipe.
Love this recipe!! I added mushrooms, diced tomatoes, & onion to the mix for more flavor and zest. The original sauce is amazing, but I added a little Alfredo on top for added boost.
Delicious! Whole family loved this.

I used 3/4 of a cup of chicken broth in lieu of white wine. I also used a combination of bacon and pancetta. When the pasta was done, I used about 1/2 cup of the salted pasta water (still warm) to the sauce mixture to thin it out a bit more. Great flavor all around (I used a lot of black pepper because, well, I love it haha)!
Was not impressed. Will not try again.
Easy to throw together and very good.
This was a really simple recipe and it was very rewarding. Loads of flavour. I used cut up leg meat. Like the idea of putting mushrooms in it. Thanks (Must stop eating it)

as Christina did, i cut up the chicken before i cooked it. this was pretty good. came out looking just like the picture. the ONLY thing i would try changing is to add some sliced white mushrooms when you saute the garlic. yumm!
Wonderful! The sauce was very flavorful, I added an additional 1/4 cup of the white wine to thin the sauce and still needed the 1/2 cup reserved water - well worth the time!!
Delicious! Very easy to make and had great flavor. I cut my chicken before cooking, just to save myself a step later. This is a keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
